alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wakulla, Gadsden, northeastern Liberty, northwestern Jefferson, Leon, Decatur, Grady, southern Thomas and southeastern Seminole Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greensboro to near Tallahassee to 9 miles northeast of Woodville. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. A gust front producing strong gusty winds was located north of these storms, approaching the Florida-Georgia state line. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, both in and possibly well ahead of storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Monticello, Florida State University, Tallahassee Community College, Thomasville, Quincy, Havana, Bainbridge, Midway, Florida A and M, Cairo, Whigham, Doak Campbell Stadium, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Wakulla, Gretna, Attapulgus and Climax. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
